title: Ticket #7513: Customized job classads appended to Requirements depending on name
description:
With 8.9.5 and using the python bindings, customized classads that start with the word 'Request' and evaluate to numbers are automatically added to the Requirements expression, expecting to find a counterpart in the machine classads. This does not happen with e.g.: 8.8.1 or 8.9.2 for example.

E.g.: RequestJobNumber will expect to find 'JobNumber' in the machine classads and

(TARGET.JobNumber >= RequestJobNumber)

will be automatically added to the job Requirements, preventing the job from matching if JobNumber is not present in the machine classads.

Expected behavior: +RequestJobNumber should be added to the job classads, but not expect anything on the machine classads side.

How to reproduce:

# Results with condor 8.9.5 

$ condor_version
$CondorVersion: 8.9.5 Dec 30 2019 BuildID: 493601 PackageID: 8.9.5-1 $
$CondorPlatform: x86_64_RedHat7 $

$ cat submit.py
import classad
import htcondor

schedd = htcondor.Schedd()
sub = htcondor.Submit("""
	universe = vanilla
	executable = test.sh
	arguments = 3
        Output = out.$(Cluster)-$(Process)
        Log = log.$(Cluster)
	""")

sub['My.JobName'] = classad.quote("jobtest1")
sub['My.AnotherJobNumber'] = '4'
sub['My.RequestJobNumber'] = '4'

with schedd.transaction() as txn:
    submitRes = sub.queue(txn)
    print("ClusterId: {}".format(submitRes))

$ python submit.py
ClusterId: 2654

$ condor_q 2654 -l | grep Requirements
Requirements = (TARGET.Arch == "X86_64") && (TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX") && (TARGET.Disk >= RequestDisk) && (TARGET.Memory >= RequestMemory) && (TARGET.JobNumber >= RequestJobNumber) && ((TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain) || (TARGET.HasFileTransfer))

## Results with 8.8.1 

$ condor_version
$CondorVersion: 8.8.1 Feb 18 2019 BuildID: 461773 PackageID: 8.8.1-1 $
$CondorPlatform: x86_64_RedHat7 $

$ cat submit.py
import classad
import htcondor

schedd = htcondor.Schedd()
sub = htcondor.Submit("""
	universe = vanilla
	executable = test.sh
	arguments = 3
        Output = out.$(Cluster)-$(Process)
        Log = log.$(Cluster)
	""")

sub['My.JobName'] = classad.quote("jobtest1")
sub['My.AnotherJobNumber'] = '4'
sub['My.RequestJobNumber'] = '4'

with schedd.transaction() as txn:
    submitRes = sub.queue(txn)
    print("ClusterId: {}".format(submitRes))
$ python submit.py
ClusterId: 774
$ condor_q 774 -l | grep Requirements
Requirements = (TARGET.Arch == "X86_64") && (TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX") && (TARGET.Disk >= RequestDisk) && (TARGET.Memory >= RequestMemory) && ((TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain) || (TARGET.HasFileTransfer))
remarks:
2020-Feb-20 11:15:42 by khurtado:
Also, something I noticed from other test jobs at CERN that also use the "request_disk" option is that depending on the schedd configuration (e.g.: SCHEDD_ROUND_ATTR_Disk set), then not only (TARGET.Disk >= RequestDisk) is added to Requirements but also "(TARGET.Disk_RAW >= RequestDisk_RAW)" which doesn't match.

E.g.: 

Requirements = (((REQUIRED_OS =?= "any") || (GLIDEIN_REQUIRED_OS =?= "any") || stringListMember(GLIDEIN_REQUIRED_OS,REQUIRED_OS)) && (AuthenticatedIdentity =!= "volunteer-node@cern.ch")) && (TARGET.Arch == "X86_64") && (TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX") && (TARGET.Disk >= RequestDisk) && (TARGET.Memory >= RequestMemory) && (TARGET.Cpus >= RequestCpus) && (TARGET.Disk_RAW >= RequestDisk_RAW) && (TARGET.ResizedCpus >= RequestResizedCpus) && (TARGET.HasFileTransfer)

2020-Mar-02 09:12:08 by khurtado:
Okay, the bug in my comment (when schedd round attributes for Disk and Memory are enabled) only happens with:

Schedd: HTCondor 8.9.2+ Python bindings: HTCondor 8.8.3

It does not happen if I use python bindings 8.9.2+. Is this something that could be fixed with a change just at the schedd level without changing the python bindings version?

2020-Apr-20 09:18:05 by khurtado:
Hello,

Any news on this? This is still an issue with 8.9.6. There is a few classads in the infrastucture that depend on creating attributes like: "Requestioslots", "RequestRepackslots", which are not so trivial to change, as it requires changes on other components in CMS.

2020-Apr-20 09:50:59 by johnkn:
This behavior is by design and not a bug, so we will need to think about ways of having the submitter explicitly declare that they want to use all, (or perhaps certain?) Request* attributes in a non-standard way.

The workaround for 8.9.6 and 8.9.7 is to refer to ioslots and repackslots in your Requirements expression in submit, this will prevent a comparison to TARGET.ioslots and TARGET.repackslots from being added to requirements.

We will add a new knob that defaults to true SUBMIT_GENERATE_CUSTOM_RESOURCE_REQUIREMENTS. setting this to false will disable requirements generation in submit for job attributes starting with Request that are not in the list of well-known resources
